snippet: In a video, a military strategist spoke out strongly against the practice of beheading, asserting that the organization founded by Osama bin Laden was more pragmatic and less extreme than the Islamic State.
abstract: Al Qaeda comes out publicly against practice of beheading in strongly worded interview with Nasr bin Ali al-Ansi, one of group's field commanders; statement makes it clear that organization is more pragmatic and less extreme than Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: In a video, a military strategist spoke out strongly against the practice of beheading, asserting that the organization founded by Osama bin Laden was more pragmatic and less extreme than the Islamic State.

headline.main: Qaeda Commander Denounces Decapitations as Used by Islamic State

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
